text: The word of the Lord came also unto Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, and go to Nineveh, that great city, and cry against it: for their wickedness is come up before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jonah rose up to flee into Tarshish, from the presence of the Lord, and went down to Japho: and he found a ship going to Tarshish: so he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it, that he might go with them unto Tarshish, from the presence of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea, so that the ship was like to be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the mariners were afraid, and cried every man unto his god, and cast the wares that were in the ship, into the sea, to lighten it of them: but Jonah was gone down into the sides of the ship, and he lay down, and was fast asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the shipmaster came to him, and said unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper? Arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said everyone to his fellow, Come, and let us cast lots, that we may know for whose cause this evil is upon us. So they cast lots, and the lot fell upon Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, Tell us for whose cause this evil is upon us? What is thine occupation? and whence comest thou? which is thy country? and of what people art thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered them, I am an Hebrew, and I fear the Lord God of heaven, which hath made the sea, and the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then were the men exceedingly afraid, and said unto him, Why hast thou done this? (for the men knew that he fled from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, What shall we do unto thee, that the sea may be calm unto us? (for the sea wrought, and was troublous)
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Take me, and cast me into the sea: so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless the men rowed to bring it to the land, but they could not: for the sea wrought, and was troublous against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore they cried unto the Lord, and said, We beseech thee, O Lord, we beseech thee, let us not perish for this man’s life, and lay not upon us innocent blood: for thou, O Lord, hast done as it pleased thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took up Jonah, and cast him into the sea, and the sea ceased from her raging.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men feared the Lord exceedingly, and offered a sacrifice unto the Lord, and made vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah: and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jonah prayed unto the Lord his God out of the fish’s belly,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, I cried in mine affliction unto the Lord, and he heard me: out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hadst cast me into the bottom in the midst of the sea, and the floods compassed me about: all thy surges, and all thy waves passed over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, I am cast away out of thy sight: yet will I look again toward thine holy Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters compassed me about unto the soul: the depth closed me round about, and the weeds were wrapped about mine head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I went down to the bottom of the mountains: the earth with her bars was about me forever, yet hast thou brought up my life from the pit, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the Lord: and my prayer came unto thee into thine holy Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that wait upon lying vanities, forsake their own mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving, and will pay that that I have vowed: salvation is of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto the fish, and it cast out Jonah upon the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the second time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, go unto Nineveh that great city, and preach unto it the preaching which I bid thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonah arose, and went to Nineveh according to the word of the Lord: now Nineveh was a great and excellent city of three days journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonah began to enter into the city a day’s journey, and he cried and said, Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people of Nineveh believed God, and proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them, even to the least of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For word came unto the king of Nineveh, and he rose from his throne, and he laid his robe from him, and covered him with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he proclaimed and said through Nineveh, (by the counsel of the king and his nobles) saying, Let neither man, nor beast, bullock nor sheep taste anything, neither feed nor drink water.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let man and beast put on sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea, let every man turn from his evil way, and from the wickedness that is in their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can tell if God will turn, and repent and turn away from his fierce wrath, that we perish not?
speaker: Narrator

text: And God saw their works that they turned from their evil ways: and God repented of the evil that he had said that he would do unto them, and he did it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he prayed unto the Lord, and said, I pray thee, O Lord, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? therefore I prevented it to flee unto Tarshish: for I knew, that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me: for it is better for me to die than to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord, Doest thou well to be angry?
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the East side of the city, and there made him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow till he might see what should be done in the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head, and deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad of the gourd.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd, that it withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sun did arise, God prepared also a fervent East wind: and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted and wished in his heart to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said unto Jonah, Doest thou well to be angry for the gourd? And he said, I do well to be angry unto the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord, Thou hast had pity on the gourd for the which thou hast not labored, neither madest it grow, which came up in a night and perished in a night,
speaker: Narrator

text: And should not I spare Nineveh that great city, wherein are sixscore thousand persons, that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand, and also much cattle?
speaker: Narrator
